title: "Using renv to create reproducible Quarto documents."

# Building a project using renv.

## Create a new project.

## install renv if not already installed using 'install.packages("renv")'.

## initiate renv using 'renv::init()'.

## Write code.

## Take a renv snapshot using 'renv::snapshot()'.

## renv::deactivate(clean = TRUE)

# Inheriting a project that used renv

## renv::restore()



::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
library(data.table)
DT = data.table(
  ID = c("b","b","b","a","a","c"),
  a = 1:6,
  b = 7:12,
  c = 13:18
)
DT
##        ID     a     b     c
##    <char> <int> <int> <int>
## 1:      b     1     7    13
## 2:      b     2     8    14
## 3:      b     3     9    15
## 4:      a     4    10    16
## 5:      a     5    11    17
## 6:      c     6    12    18
```
:::
